result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Leshawn Blunt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank.
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges including the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections along with costs, fees, surcharges from case 18CF4266 from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing subject to civil judgment.
Court waived nonmandatory costs and fees due to inability to pay.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with sentence in 18CF4266.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Leshawn Blunt

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT with Sentence in 18 CF 4266  with credit for 73 DAYS time served .

-The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections along with costs, fees, surcharges from case 18 CF 4266 from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Court waived non madatory costs and fees due to inability to pay.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.


Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Ineligible Voting Notice and Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  mn

Defendant Christopher Leshawn Blunt in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Christopher Leshawn Blunt in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  AS TO COUNT 8:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pusuant to negotiations, the Court Dismissed Count 9 but will read in for sentencing purposes.

OFF THE RECORD- Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court, defendant Christopher Leshawn Blunt not in court, in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Sentencing Hearing. Defendant not produced. Discussion with parties. Court sets next court date for a Plea/Sentencing date. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights

Amended Plea Questionnaire and Waiver
Case re-assign to Branch 16 Judge Grayson due to lower pending case 18CF4266

Defendant Christopher Leshawn Blunt in court with Attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of 18CF4266.  Sworn for the State: MPD Sargent K. Burtch  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Christopher Leshawn Blunt in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter in court for Preliminary hearing. Defense requests adjournment so that case can be heard with co-def's case. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

This case was scheduled in Br 17 instead of Preliminary Hearing Court.  
This clerk added case to preliminary court calendar.
Please see prior open case # 18CF4266 for defendants Blunt and 21CF2392 for co-def. Riley
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Christopher Leshawn Blunt in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Christopher Leshawn Blunt in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Leshawn Blunt appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
